metadata.Title: CVE-2023-42752 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow flaw was found in the Linux kernel. This issue leads to the kernel allocating `skb_shared_info` in the userspace, which is exploitable in systems without SMAP protection since `skb_shared_info` contains references to function pointers. Kyle Zeng discovered that the networking stack implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate skb object size in certain conditions. An attacker could use this cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-170-generic - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-lowlatency - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-170-generic - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-170-lowlatency - 3.13.0-194.245
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1044-aws - 4.4.0-1124.130
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1171-azure - 4.15.0-1171.186~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
